content:
robert.bent said
Please look emailscan2. The blue text is replacing buttons to click on and get a link to that subject in the web page. By button I mean something similar to your "solved the problem" button. In some emails there are no buttons and no blue text, which means I cannot, for example, rate a supplier - even though I've been invited to do so. Does this clarify?

I read this and from context I assume you think there is some form of image included in this or one of your earlier posts. There is not.

Perhaps follow the apple instructions on how to take a screenshot. I can't assist you with it as I do not play with apple products. But I suspect from the named object you mention including the word scan that it is not a screen shot as described in the apple article. Once you have your screenshot save it as a PNG file and upload it to a reply on the forum using the Browser button below the area for entering text. (this forum supports JPEG,PNG and Gif image formats only)

robert.bent said
I have tried to install a previous version (which was perfect) but your system insists on giving me the latest version - a typical Google trick!

Not a trick, just a way to try and stop folk totally scrambling their data by trying to go back to an older version after the profile has been converted for the newer version. Without being aware of the risks their actions present. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/dedicated-profile-thunderbird-installation

Sadly this forum has plenty of posts from folk used to using apples time machine to fix everything. Except Thunderbird, with that they generally just make their issues much worse.

However if you are determined to downgrade, be my guest. You can download every version of Thunderbird that has ever been released from this site. http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/

First select the version, then the operating system. Finally select the language version you use. (en_US is the American one.)

Not a situation I can live with. After 20 years I need another provider!

Just to be clear, this is a peer support forum. The normally assumed attitudes of "fix it or I will go somewhere else" are wasted here. I, like others offering assistance here, use Thunderbird and really do not care if you do or not. We offer our time to help our peers and passive aggressive consumer threats offer nothing but a barrier between your need for support and someone feeling like helping you.

I am guessing you are looking for the allow remote content bar at the top of the message. It is the only thing I can think of that might be described as "There is no download remote option" as discussed here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/remote-content-in-messages#thunderbird:mac:tb115

Perhaps you could confirm if I am guessing correctly.

These discussions may assist as they are on the same topic. I still stick to my response in the latter topic if none of the other options assist. Safe mode is very useful in diagnostic situations. https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1284935 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1315157

content:
Are you saying you want to delete the Gmail account in Thunderbird?

If so, first of all make sure to backup any mail you want to keep currently stored in the Gmail account.

Press Alt or F10 in case the menu bar is hidden. From the main menu bar: Tools - Account Settings Select the account to be deleted in the left pane. Select 'Remove Account' from the 'Account Action' drop-down menu at the bottom.

Hola, Veo todo bien en la configuracion del SMTP, prueba si el problema desaparece con el Firewall de la PC deshabilitado, en ese caso se debe crear una regla permitida para el Thunderbird/SMTP. Hay algunos casos donde previamente no se estaba usando OAuth2 y luego de actualizar y migrar a OAuth2 no se pueden enviar correos: ver "MS OAuth & Exchange related issues (relevant tags: msoauth, exchange):" en el siguiente link: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird/Support/TB115.0SupportIssues

Si el problema persiste se podría probar creando un perfil nuevo de Thunderbird y configurando la cuenta nuevamente, esto seria como un Thunderbird recién instalado. Saludos

content:
The crash only happened once and I'm happy to post the log, but this does not seem to be the problem here. After pulling off a fair bit of hairs, it seems that a correct explanation of the problem is the following (I started from a fresh empty profile).

I have 2 accounts, from the same mail provider (LaPoste) with no difference, they both don't have any personal folder. That provider has that unusual folder organization where everything is under INBOX and their folder for sent email is INBOX/OUTBOX (I know...), drafts are under INBOX/DRAFT and junk under INBOX/QUARANTAINE

When I add account n°1, TB detects that it should place a copy of sent email in INBOX/OUTBOX and same for draft and junk (although for junk, it does not automatically activate "Move new junk..." but the selected grayed out option is other, "INBOX/QUARANTAINE". In account settings, the "Place a copy in" would show "No available" folder under option ""Sent" Folder on:" is active with and correctly displays "OUTBOX". When I go under the " all folders" view, the INBOX/OUTBOX correctly as the green flying envelope icon.

When I add account n°1, TB does not do any of that detection and wants to create Sent, Drafts and Junk folders. Well, no big deal, I could change that manually although it is *super* weird why it would work in one case and not the other. Again, same provider, fresh profile, no difference I can think of.

Now, the real problem seems to be with unified folder that try to be too smart I guess. I want, for both account, to store sent message locally but other email clients (e.g. my iphone) will still put its sent message in INBOX/OUTBOX. What I'd like to do is when I chose the folders to be used in "Sent" unified folder, to have both INBOX/OUTBOX and the local folder. I do that through the properties of the "Sent" unified folder.

But what seems to happen is that TB seems to only follow what was set in "Place a copy in" from account settings, and even if I have checked the INBOX/OUTBOX for that account, there is no subfolder entry created.
creator: philippe_44

content:
I know it's tricky, but the instructions work. Here is my own documentation on threading, duplicating the above, but it may help: You need to highlight each folder and click View>sort by>unthreaded. If this applies to just a few folders, just repeat the process as necessary. If you have many folders or plan to add many new folders, you may wish a different approach, below:

More info: To change default for *new* folders, In config editor, you can change default that applies to NEW folders you set up: mailnews.default_view_flags 0=unthreaded

Config editor is available at Tools>settings>general and scroll to bottom right. 

 ------------

To set many *existing* folders, follow these steps: (I creates a crude video that walks through the steps at https://davidkirk.org/SettingDefaultFolderView.mp4 that demonstrates the following steps: 

   First, highlight a folder that you have set to unthreaded	    In the Message List view, in the column header, on the far right, open the options button that shows         context menu. :    At the very bottom is the option:    -> "Apply current view to..."    -> "Folder and its children..."    -> Hover over an account    -> In the next menu don't select a folder. Instead select the account name itself.  ALSO, for future installations of Thunderbird,  - install Thunderbird and exit prior to setting up accounts - create a simple text file with name of user.js with these lines:       // Set default threading to UNthreaded  ###   <== this line is optional, just for documentation      user_pref("mailnews.default_view_flags", 0); - copy the user.js file into the profile - now, when you start Thunderbird, unthreading will be the default. Problem solved.

content: macOS Ventura 13.5.2 Thunderbird 115.2.3 (64-bit) Connecting to O365 Exchange outlook.office365.com
creator: r.burrowes

content:
You need to update your account's SMTP settings as follows:

Server Name = smtp.office365.com Port = 587 Connection security = STARTTLS Authentication method = Normal Password

Then, using a browser, sign in to your Microsoft account and generate an app password. It is that app password that you will use when Thunderbird asks for a password when you send mail. Your regular password will NOT work with Normal Password Authentication method, because Microsoft has stopped supporting basic authentication using your MS account's regular password on its MS (Office) 365 platform that powers your msn email service.

content: Turn off the Unified Folders view and turn it back on. If that alone doesn't fix it, right-click the Sent unified folder, select Properties, then click the Choose button. Make sure the Sent folder for all accounts are ticked, then click OK then finally click Update. This should update the Sent Unified Folder.
